TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 475
TEI.2.document_title: B T Jacques to E R Wightman, 09-07-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Benjamin T. Jaques to Ellas R. Wightman, August 30, 1830, Surveying
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 475

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Benjamin T. Jaques to Ellas R. Wightman, August 30, 1830, Surveying*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="08-30-1830">Augt. 30 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr E. R. Wighman*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Weigh[t]man*/person_mentioned* It being out of my Power to go down to see you survey my *location_mentioned*Land */location_mentioned*at this time If you have not done it I wish you to write me imediately and perhaps I will be able to come down— If you should be surveying at this time I wish you to doe it to the best advantage for me Yours*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Benjn T Jaques*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="09-07-1830">Sept 7th 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
